definition.title: What Temperature Is Considered a Fever?
definition.content: A body temperature of 38.0Â°C (100.4Â°F) or higher is generally considered a fever for adults and children. Temperatures between 37.6Â°C and 37.9Â°C are often classified as a low-grade or slight fever.

converter.title: Quick Temperature Converter
converter.description: Convert between Celsius and Fahrenheit for any temperature value:

validation.range: Please enter a temperature between 35Â°C and 42Â°C
validation.danger: DANGEROUS: This is a medical emergency. Seek immediate care.
validation.high: HIGH FEVER: Seek medical care, especially for children.
validation.moderate: MODERATE FEVER: Consider consulting a doctor.
validation.lowGrade: LOW-GRADE FEVER: Rest and monitor symptoms.

infants.threshold: Fever threshold: Any temperature ≥38.0Â°C (100.4Â°F) requires immediate medical attention.
tips: Even low-grade fever can be serious

children.threshold: Fever threshold: ≥38.0Â°C (100.4Â°F) - monitor closely and consult doctor if concerned.

adults.threshold: Fever threshold: ≥38.0Â°C (100.4Â°F) - usually manageable at home unless severe.
tips: Seek care if fever >39.4Â°C (103Â°F) or lasts >3 days

measurement.title: Temperature Measurement Methods
measurement.description: Different methods yield slightly different results. Here's what you need to know:

oral.title: Oral
oral.note: Wait 30 minutes after eating/drinking for accurate reading.

ear.title: Ear (Tympanic)
ear.note: Quick and convenient but can be affected by earwax.

forehead.title: Forehead (Temporal)
forehead.note: Good for screening but less accurate than other methods.

axillary.title: Axillary (Armpit)
axillary.note: Least accurate method, typically 0.5-1.0Â°C lower than core temperature.

download.title: Download Printable Fever Temperature Chart
download.description: Get our comprehensive one-page PDF reference guide for quick access at home or medical facility.
download.note: PDF includes: Fever temperature ranges, conversion chart, age-specific guidelines, and emergency contacts.

disclaimer.title: Important Medical Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: Disclaimer: This fever temperature chart is for educational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always consult with a healthcare provider for medical concerns, especially for infants, young children, or individuals with compromised immune systems.

faq.q1: What temperature is considered a fever?
faq.a1: A body temperature of 38.0Â°C (100.4Â°F) or higher is generally considered a fever for adults and children.
faq.q2: What is a dangerous fever temperature?
faq.a2: A fever above 39.4Â°C (103Â°F) in adults or over 38Â°C (100.4Â°F) in infants under 3 months is considered concerning and may require medical attention. Temperatures above 41.1Â°C (106Â°F) are considered a medical emergency (hyperpyrexia).
faq.q3: What is the normal range for body temperature?
faq.a3: The normal body temperature range is typically between 36.5Â°C and 37.5Â°C (97.7Â°F - 99.5Â°F).
